Title: 3DHOP: A Novel Technological Solution for the Development of Online Virtual Museums
Authors: Marco Potenziani, M. Callieri, Roberto Scopigno
Abstract summary: This paper does not contain industry case studies of automated decision support for energy system operators.

Title: Context-based decision support for sustainable optimization of energy consumption
Authors: M. Marques, B. Sučić, T. Vuk
Abstract summary: The paper presents a context-based decision support algorithm for optimizing energy consumption in industry.

Title: Decision Support System for a Low Voltage Renewable Energy System
Authors: Iulia Stamatescu, N. Arghira, I. Fagarasan, G. Stamatescu, S. Iliescu, V. Calofir
Abstract summary: A decision support system was developed and tested for a low-voltage renewable energy microgrid to achieve energy balance.

Title: Supporting Control Room Operators in Highly Automated Future Power Networks
Authors: Minjiang Chen, V. Catterson, M. Syed, S. Mcarthur, G. Burt, M. Marinelli, A. Prostejovsky, K. Heussen
Abstract summary: The paper investigates decision support functions for power system operators to handle frequency deviation events in highly automated future power networks.

Title: Enhanced situational awareness and decision support for operators of future distributed power network architectures
Authors: A. Zaher, V. Catterson, M. Syed, S. Mcarthur, G. Burt, Minjiang Chen, M. Marinelli, A. Prostejovsky
Venue: IEEE PES Innovative Smart Grid Technologies Conference Europe
Abstract summary: The paper describes a control room decision support system for future power network operators to aid in restoring frequency during incidents.

Title: An Automated Fault Location System as a Decision Support Tool for System Operators
Authors: J. Vasco, R. Ramlachan, J. Wong, Lee Wang
Venue: 2008 61st Annual Conference for Protective Relay Engineers
Abstract summary: An automated fault location system can provide system operators with accurate fault information to optimize their decision-making process.

Title: Automatic decision support with a new visualization concept for power systems
Venue: 2001 IEEE Porto Power Tech Proceedings (Cat. No.01EX502)
Abstract summary: A new visualization concept provides automated decision support for power system operators by reducing data complexity and suggesting control actions.

Title: Implementing Industry 4.0: An In-Depth Case Study Integrating Digitalisation and Modelling for Decision Support System Applications
Authors: Akshay Ranade, Javier Gómez, Andrew de Juan, William D. Chicaiza, Michael Ahern, J. M. Escaño, A. Hryshchenko, Olan Casey, Aidan Cloonan, D. O’Sullivan, Ken Bruton, Alan Mcgibney
Abstract summary: The paper presents a case study of implementing Industry 4.0 technologies, including data-driven decision support systems, to enhance energy efficiency in a manufacturing process.
